TopicTitle: How many rockets you accidentally destroyed?

Articles.Content:
Alright, for this first time, i'am asking a question for the KSP Community how many rockets you accidentally destroyed.

For my first time playing KSP, I builded a small rocket-missile like, uh.. i forgot staging the rocket

cause i didn't know how to play.

Now i wanna see your history

Too many to count  

Staging issues are a pretty common cause, but I've also lost a lot to landing failures. 

My most impressive loss was when I set up an intercept with another craft in orbit I was intending to dock with, and ended up colliding with it half an orbit later!

I'm a big believer in Revert or F9.
I never revert, and Jebediah always dies.
As many as there are grains of sand.

As many as there are stars.


Happy landings!

Launch success rate is somewhere around pro baseball batting averages. I am getting pretty good.

Edited November 28, 2019 by ExtremeSquared
3 (or so)
# of failure = exp((# stars in this universe)*(grains  of sand in the Sahara))

52 minutes ago, BeanThruster said:

# of failure = exp((# stars in this universe)*(grains  of sand in the Sahara))

That would be zero then as the correct term is 'sand grains'.

The very very first time I've ever played KSP, I chose to play career mode. (pretty surprising, but I switched to sandbox soon after) With the limited amount of parts I had, I made the standard starter rocket with tiny fins, solid booster, pod, and parachute. I was ready.

My fingers slowly pressed into my spacebar, and I watched as my booster and parachute both deployed at the same time, soon after crashing into the ground.

Then I learned what staging was.

3 hours ago, UltimateFlash15 said:

The very very first time I've ever played KSP... I watched as my booster and parachute both deployed at the same time...

Hell, I do that every time I start a new career game.

There's no reason those two should be on the same staging level.
How many of them I accidentally didn't?
I can't even remember how many rockets I accidently launched...a few more than I crashed I think.
Over 9000

Too many or not enough, depending on who (Mortimer or Werhner) is asking.

The more interesting question is how many did I deliberately destroy?

Edited December 9, 2019 by StrandedonEarth
Define "Rocket" (do weird contraptions count)
at least 25
Every rocket I destroyed was an accident.  And you can't prove otherwise.
I can't actually answer that one. I've played since .18 was the demo and bought my first actual game when it was .22. Oh, and I still have catastrophic failures...

About 1 mole of rockets, give or take a few quadrillion.

Planes are a whole different matter, in that I try not to destroy them. Destroyed planes are probably somewhere in the thousands.

Edited December 12, 2019 by Kernel Kraken

Look at the sky at night somewere with 0 light contamination

The sky will be full of stars

 

There will not be enought to count all of them
